description: Level 2-3 골드 스펙 6개 스테이지 - CLI 확장/린트 준비

stages.title: 일상 습관 + 빈도부사
stages.intent: 일상 루틴과 습관을 빈도부사(always/usually/often/sometimes/rarely/hardly ever/never)로 자연스럽게 말하고, 의문/부정에서도 위치를 정확히 유지한다.
lexset: wake up, have breakfast, work out, check email/phone, cook, read, commute, go to bed, meet, study, drink coffee/water, take a walk
traps: 빈도부사 위치 오류(일반동사 앞: I often go / 조동사 뒤: I can often go / be동사 뒤: I am often late)
3인칭 단수 -s 누락(He usually go → goes)
never와 부정 중복(I don't never → I never)

seeds.en: I usually wake up at seven.

seeds.kr: 나는 거의 밤에 커피를 안 마셔.
seeds.en: I hardly ever drink coffee at night.
She usually goes to bed at ten.
How often do you work out?
He always checks his email in the morning.

stages.title: 조동사(의무/허가/가능/권고)
stages.intent: 조동사(can/could/should/must/have to/don't have to/may/need to)로 요청·권고·의무·허가를 자연스럽게 말하고 물어본다.
lexset: help, call back, finish, submit, attend, bring, wear, borrow, lend, open, use, park, schedule, reschedule, cancel, join, leave
traps: mustn't(금지) vs don't have to(필요 없음) 혼동
조동사 뒤 동사원형 유지(can to go ✗)
의문문 do-support 사용 금지(Can you...?, Should I...?)
어순 오류 및 공손도(could/may의 정중함) 미스매치

seeds.en: Can you help me with this?
I have to call him back.
I need to finish this today.
You don't have to worry about that.
Could you speak a bit more slowly?

seeds.kr: 그 제안을 다시 고려하는 게 좋겠어.

seeds.en: Can I ask you a question?

stages.title: There is/are + This/That/These/Those + 관사
stages.intent: 존재·위치 설명(There is/are)와 지시어(This/That/These/Those), a/an/the/무관사 사용을 정확히 구분한다.
lexset: seat, idea, problem, charger, restroom, meeting room, copy, coffee, noise, people, document, bus stop, café, umbrella, bottle
traps: There is/are vs It is/They are 혼동
단복수 일치(There's many seats ✗ → There are many seats)
관사 누락(a charger / the charger / Ø coffee)
지시어 거리감/수 일치(this/that/these/those)

seeds.en: There are some seats over there.
That is not a good idea.
Is there a restroom on this floor?
There is a café near here.
These are the documents you asked for.
There is a bus stop on the corner.
There aren't many people in that room.
There is some water in this bottle.

stages.title: Wh-의문문(현재·과거·빈도·수량)
lexset: go, come, buy, cost, start, finish, meet, call, study, work out, take, take time, happen
traps: be동사 vs 일반동사 의문문 구분(Where are you? / Where do you go?)
전치사 위치(Who did you talk to?)
How much/many 가산/불가산
시제 일치(When did you move?)

seeds.en: Where do you usually work out?
How often do you go there?
What time does the meeting start?

stages.title: 감정 표현 + 경험 공유(의견·반응)
stages.intent: 감정을 형용사/동사 콜로케이션으로 자연스럽게 말하고, 간단한 과거 경험/반응을 연결해서 설명한다.
lexset: excited about, worried about, disappointed with, proud of, tired of, interested in, curious about, looking forward to ~ing, it sounds/looks/seems ~
traps: 전치사 선택(about/with/of/in)
look forward to + 동명사
It sounds/looks + adj 구조
so vs very vs really 강조어 남용

seeds.en: I'm really excited about the trip.
I was a bit disappointed with the result.
I'm looking forward to seeing you.
It seemed a bit difficult to me.

seeds.kr: 나는 그 영화가 기대 이하였다고 느꼈어.
seeds.en: I felt the movie was below my expectations.
He was proud of his team.
I'm curious about why that is.

stages.title: 현재완료(경험/결과/최근) — 핵심 패턴
stages.intent: ever/never/just/already/yet, for/since를 사용해 경험/최근 변화/결과를 현재완료로 자연스럽게 말한다.
lexset: try, visit, hear, finish, lose, start, move, change, know, meet, arrive, decide, break, catch, learn
traps: 현재완료 vs 과거시제 혼동(I saw vs I have seen)
since/for 잘못 사용
gone/been 구분(He has gone to vs been to)
yet의 위치(부정/의문에서 문장 끝)

seeds.kr: 그를 여러 번 만난 적 있어.
그는 파리에 가 본 적 없어.
seeds.en: He has never been to Paris.
We have known each other for a long time.
I haven't bought the tickets yet.
Have you ever heard that news?

expansion_hints.form_coverage: aff 60% / neg 20% / wh_q 20% (Wh 중심 스테이지는 wh_q 70%까지 상향)
